page.title: 12Changes in Tresillian (2)
page.content: Religion has also changed.In 1945 many people went to church on Sundays, but nowadays there has been a slow decline in people going to church. The change that might occur soon is the council building a by-pass round Tresillian to cater for the extra traffic going in and out of Truro. It is highly suprising to know that there were no street lamps in Tresillian village until 1968! Most services have improved although shops are very few in Tresillian and this situation seems to be getting worse as the post office may close soon.Most villagers are not worried about this because they think having more shops in Tresillian would spoil its unique beauty.
